title: Game Mode: The Great Poro Roundup!
body:
Map: Summoners Rift (winter skin)
 
**Changes: **
- the Nexus is replaced with a circular poro pasture filled with piles of poro snacks. 
- Baron is replaced with a gigantic poro (The Grand Poro) wearing a mustache and a Santa hat.

**Game Play:** 
- Walking into your base's pasture will grant you 5 poro snacks if your trinket slot is not filled. 
- Slaying an enemy will spawn one neutral poro. 
- Feeding a neutral poro will befriend it. 
- Befriended poros are tinted either blue or purple depending on what team you are on. Once  Befriended the poro will follow the campion (limit of 10 poros following a single champ. Poros fed after 10 will just disappear.). A Stacking speed buff (fuzzy skates) is granted for each poro.
- When a champion dies their poros become neutral and scatter. 
- Poros can not enter a fountain, back, teleport, flash, or follow with like-flash abilities. When the bond is broken in this way the poros will stay in place but will become neutral. (hint: break bonds in a safe place to horde poros or transfer them to teammates. ) 
- Another buff may be gained based on the number of poros a single champion has following them. 
               3 - increased xp  and gold per 5
                      5 - increased armer, magic resist, health regen, and 
                                mana regen. 
                       8 - increased AP, AD, attack speed, and CDR. 
                     10 - increased damage to structures. Basic attacks  
                                  deal 10% of a structures max health. 

 -Poros are afraid of turrets receiving turret damage will cause poros to become neutral and scatter. 
- To befriend the Grand Poro a champion must have 3 Befriended Poros. The champion will channel the Grand Poro, feeding him 5 poro snacks. The Grand Poro emits a massive speed buff aura (Cuddle Sled) . If the bond is broken with the Grand Poro he will slowly walk back to his spawn point and cannot be befriended until he returns. 
- Enemy minions will transform into poros befriended by the enemy teem if they cross over into the pasture.
-  Befriended poros will remain in an enemy pasture if they cross over. The pasture cannot be entered by enemies if the final turrets or all inhibitors are up. 
- The Grand Poro can only enter enemy bases. 
**
Winning:**
* The game is won when a team moves 30 poros or the Grand Poro into the enemies pasture.

> You had me at 'poro'. :3

… and then again at the second mention of "poro".
Every ten minutes Volibear spawns and goes after Poro Snax
Silly bear, snacks are for poros!

I am very much in favor of poro-based game modes. The best bug I've ever experienced in this game was when in an ARAM when we exploded a poro Dragonslayer Braum had fed and the mustache stayed behind, hopping around.

The intended behavior is that when all 10 players feed their poro snax to the same poro, it explodes into a bunch of little poros, and if Braum feeds a poro, it gets a mustache. I think the bug was that the mustache is coded as a separate object attached to the poro, and that the huge poro was just made invisible rather than removed, and nobody ever thought to add a trigger to make the  mustache become invisible. Few people play ARAM on the PBE, and few people ever manage to get everybody to feed the same poro, so it's easy for the bug to have made it to live. I'm pretty sure it's changed by now though.
A Poro game mode... I am so in.
